title: Jack Whitehall webchat â as it happened | Film | The Guardian
summary: 'layton williams ( stephen in bad education ) makes mariah carey look reasonable '
'i would undo everything michael gove did '
'my favourite female comic at the moment is katherine ryan '
'my comedy heroes growing up were harry enfield , john cleese and peter sellers '
'phil collins is the reason i get up every morning '

documents.title: that 's it for today !
text: guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:28pm thank you for all the questions .
i 'll rephrase that : thank you for some of the questions .

documents.title: 'i would undo everything michael gove did '
text: opus147 asks : what would you change about the education system ?
the real one , i mean , not the one in bad education ( unless they are the same ) .
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:27pm undo everything michael gove did .
starting by allowing american literature to be on the syllabus .
utilityforward asks : what 's your favourite biscuit ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:24pm well , you want me to say `` soggy '' , but i 'm going to say hobnob .
a very absorbant one .
simren asks : any advice for a-level results day ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:22pm make sure you get your results before you do anything stupid , like firing off some parting shots to a teacher that you did n't like .
you may be required to resit the exam and see the teacher again .
i speak of this informed by experience , as it happened to a `` friend '' of mine .

documents.title: 'my favourite female comic at the moment is katherine ryan '
text: downtownpeter asks : who is your favourite female comic ?
do you love amy schumer ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:19pm i do like amy schumer .
and my favourite female comic at the moment is katherine ryan , who i think is our country 's amy schumer , even though she 's canadian .

documents.title: 'i failed my drama gcse '
text: reece gibb asks : if you were a real teacher , what would your preferred subject be ?
i 'm going for drama .
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:18pm i failed my drama gcse .
so probably not .
probably something practical , like latin .
esther # imcrazy asks : who is your favourite actor ?
if you found them in westfield , would you follow them and see where they shop and where they eat ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:17pm dwayne johnson .
but i doubt he shops in westfield .
i think he 's more of a bluewater guy .

documents.title: 'my comedy heroes growing up were harry enfield , john cleese and peter sellers '
text: downtownpeter asks : who were your comedy heroes growing up and who do you think will be the next generation 's heroes ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:16pm harry enfield .
john cleese .
peter sellers .
i love their physicality ; they all create very big characters that are rooted in reality .
the next generation of comedy heroes , i recently saw a comedy feed on bbc iplayer called people time , which was performed and written by some of the country 's most talented young comedians .
the bbc would be mad not to commission a series .
neartheclocktower asks : today is world lion day , apparently .
if you were a lion , what would your name be ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:12pm cecil the second .
alexandra gazi asks : which do you enjoy more : standup comedy or acting ?

guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:11pm whenever i spend a long time acting i feel the need to get back on stage , and whenever i 'm on tour for ages i eventually end up thinking that i 'd prefer to be filming something on set .
i read an interview once with stephen fry and he said : `` the other man 's arse is always cleaner '' .
which is an aphorism i would apply to my own career .

documents.title: 'layton williams ( stephen in bad education ) makes mariah carey look reasonable '
text: id3888624 asks : bad education downloads are getting me through my holiday with my parents .
can i ask , who is the hardest in the cast to work with ?
i called my fantasy football team special k in your honour .
but my dad 's just reminded me what special k is oops !
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:04pm some people would pussyfoot around answering such a delicate question , but 100 % it 's leyton williams who plays stephen .
he once made me hold a hand fan to his face for a whole lunch break because he 'd overheated .
he makes mariah carey look reasonable .
gretsch83 asks : according to wikipedia , we share the same birthday and i was 5 when you were born .
do you remember your own 5th birthday party ?
# july7birthdayheaven guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:03pm my 5th birthday party was a pirate themed birthday party , and i made my grandparents dress up as sailors .
i still have photos of my poor granddad in a tight striped t-shirt , looking like a geriatric waiter at pizza express .
you share a birthday with me , which is kind of cool , but not as cool as the next fact i 'm going to tell you : you also share a birthday with jeremy kyle .
he probably spent his fifth birthday refereeing an argument he manufactured between his parents .

documents.title: 'phil collins is the reason i get up every morning '
text: nordyne asks : do you like phil collins ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:00pm he 's the reason i get up every morning .
adam chapman asks : what advice would you give for those who want to get into the world of comedy ?
i 've always wanted to but never had the balls to go for it .

guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 1:00pm book yourself into a gig , tell a load of your friends the time place and date , and if you get second thoughts , and try and wimp out of it , you 'll be peer pressured not to do so .
then if it 's a disaster you can blame them .
daitarn3 asks : is it true that all comedians secretly hate each other ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:58pm no , i think they 're pretty open about it .
methzzz asks : what 's the best show you have ever seen at the edinburgh fringe ?
last year 's highlight for me was marcel lucont , the stereoty french man guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:58pm marcel lucont is hilarious .
but the best edinburgh show i 've ever seen is nick mohammed , mr swallow the musical .
which was his cack-handed attempt to put on a musical performance of dracula .
i 've never laughed as much in my life .

documents.title: 'i 'd risk sharing a bath with jeremy corbyn so i could have a chat with him '
text: jack harrison asks : which one of the current labour leadership contenders would you rather share a bath with , and what would you talk about ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:56pm andy burnham looks the most hygienic i think , but i 'd most like to meet jeremy corbyn , so i 'd probably risk it to have a chat with him .
though he 'd have to take the tap end .
larringtonlobster asks : would you rather try your luck in a provincial wetherspoons or a provincial yates 's wine lodge ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:53pm probably yates 's wine lodge .

when i was 18 , i went to the wetherspoons in putney where i live on a sunday afternoon , and a bar fight broke out during which i heard a man shout out a sentence i have never heard before or since : you 've just chaired my sister .

documents.title: 'i enjoyed the scene in fresh meat where i suffocate joe thomas with my fake breasts '
text: nicl asks : what was your favourite scene from fresh meat ?
i loved that show !
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:52pm i enjoyed the scene where i had to fight joe thomas dressed as a hooters waitress , and suffocate him with my fake breasts .
we had to rehearse it with a stunt co-ordinator , who had worked on all the james bond films , and who was deadly serious , giving advice on how to sell a punch .
all with me in a blonde wig and wearing fake breasts .
judgedamnation asks : i was an extra on the bad education film .
was it just me or was it unbearably fucking cold in that castle ?
also , do you know why the director insisted on people not wearing any blue on set ?
thanks , looking forward to seeing the finished product guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:49pm it was unbearably cold in that castle .
i would have lent you my jacket had you asked , so apologies for that .
the reason the director would n't let anyone wear blue is that he had a terrible , terrible experience filming the smurfs movie , and it 's haunted him ever since .
hana hanz asks : god i love you .
if you could be any of the characters that you 've played for the rest of your life who would you be ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:48pm lady diana .
phil cole asks : when 's fresh meat back ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:46pm we 've filmed it all , so hopefully the end of the year .
we all graduate , it 's very sad , and you also get to meet jp 's brother tomothy .
he 's a city trader who turns up and tries to make jp get a job at his bank , and then he tries to shag one of the housemates .
i wo n't say which one , but it 's not howard .
bewilderedmark asks : if you shaved your beard off , how old would you look ?
guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:43pm i look about 12 when i shave my beard off , so try not to do so .
but the last time i was barefaced was to play princess diana in psychobitches .
as diana i look good without a beard , but only as diana .

documents.title: 'one day i hope to step into noel edmonds ' shoes '
text: noirnoirnoir asks : are you the new noel edmonds ?

guardian contributor jackwhitehall 11 august 2015 12:41pm yes , i 've been an admirer of his work for a long time , and got to meet him once because i was staying in the same hotel as all the deal or no deal contestants .
he passed on sage advice , and one day i hope to step into his shoes .

documents.title: jack 's with us now
text: here he is at guardian towers beaumont-thomas

documents.title: post your questions for jack whitehall
text: jack whitehall has successfully cultivated one of the best-known personae in british comedy : an indignant posh boy who is nevertheless charming enough to be loved by the plebs .

he deployed it first on stage , tying himself up in knots at his hatred of schoolchum robert pattinson , and then parlayed it into a tv career , playing banter-fixated undergrad jp in fresh meat and an irresponsible teacher in bad education .
he 's now making the jump to the big screen with the latter role , as the ever-quipping alfie wickers takes his young charges on a school trip to cornwall .
perhaps buoyed by the success of two inbetweeners movies , it cleaves to dumb but satisfying gross-out comedy , involving teabagged swans , naked ziplining , and lots of cornish stereotypes .
ahead of it hitting cinemas on august 21 , jack is joining us to answer your questions about it and indeed anything else .
post them in the comments below , and he 'll answer them from 12.40pm onwards on tuesday august 11 .

bulletin.text: As he gets ready to hit the big screen with The Bad Education Movie, comedian Jack Whitehall joined us to answer your questions on everything from his comedy heroes to which one of the Labour leadership contenders he would rather share a bath with.
